column4: I tried the things listed in the bug report - but it still doesn't work :0(
Should I just wait until the developers fix it? How long is that likely to take?
OK that didn't help - in gnome-failsafe it does the same thing, and killall gnome-panel just says "no such process" again :(
explain what you mean by 'b0rked'? what actually happens?
log out, jump to a console, delete ~/.gnome2/session
then kill off all your processes and log in again
stay logged in, jump to a console - is there a gnome-panel process running?
If I do a locate for gnome-panel it doesnt find anything but schemas etc... should there not be an actual gnome-panel binary somewhere?
um, dude, come on... sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
